meanings.definition: In a manner that cannot be justified or forgiven.
meanings.sent1: She inexcusably forgot her best friend's birthday.
meanings.sent2: He inexcusably skipped his important meeting.
meanings.sent3: The cat inexcusably knocked over the vase while chasing a fly.
meanings.sent4: The storm inexcusably destroyed the newly planted garden.
meanings.sent5: The student inexcusably copied the answers during the exam.

meanings.definition: In a way that is without excuse.
meanings.sent1: The employee inexcusably arrived late to work every day.
meanings.sent2: She inexcusably left the door unlocked when she went out.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel inexcusably stole all the birdseed from the feeder.
meanings.sent4: The fire inexcusably spread to the neighboring houses.
meanings.sent5: The chef inexcusably served undercooked chicken to the customers.
